Surgical resection is appropriate for patients with resectable pancreatic cancer followed by combined chemotherapy.

Metastatic disease is treated with combined chemotherapy. Palliative measures to alleviate pain in patients with unresectable or metastatic disease include optimization of analgesic medications, radiation therapy, chemical splanchnicectomy, or celiac nerve blocks. Palliation of biliary obstruction may be achieved with surgical biliary bypass, percutaneous radiology biliary stent placement, or endoscopic biliary stent placement.
